content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can do it:

```julia
Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, x.value, " ", x.unit)
```

This `show` method will take an IO object and a FloatWithUnits object as parameters. It will then print the value and unit of your FloatWithUnits object to the provided IO stream. 

Please note that you should define the `FloatWithUnits` struct with fields before using this function, e.g.,
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end
```
